column3: et ab insurgèntibus in me líbera me. ^ Deliver me from my enemies
column5: and from them that rise up against me free me.

column2: et de vìrîs sángŭinum salva me. ^ Deliver me from them that work iniquity
column3: and save me from bloody men.

column1: 4 ^ Qŭia ecce cepérunt ánimam meam~; irruvérunt in me fortes. ^ For behold they have caught my soul~; the mighty have rushed in upon me.

column4: et diréxi. ^ Neither is it my iniquity
column6: O Lord~; without iniquity have I run
intènde ad visitándas omnes gentes~; non misereáris òmnibus qŭi operántur iniqŭitátem. ^ Rise up thou to meet me
column11: attend to visit all the nations~; have no mercy on all them that work iniquity.

column3: et circumíbunt civitátem. ^ They shall return at evening
column4: and shall suffer hunger as dogs
column5: and shall go round about the city.

column2: et gládius in lábiîs eórum~; ¿~qŭóniam qŭìs aŭdívit~? ^ Behold they shall speak with their mouth
column3: and a sword is in their lips~; for who has heard~?
deridébis eos~; ad nìhilum dedúces omnes gentes. ^ But thou
column5: shalt laugh at them~; thou shalt bring all the nations to nothing.

column2: qŭia Deus suscèptor meus ès. ^ I will keep my strength to thee
misericórdia ejus praĕvèniet me~; Deus ostèndet mìhi super inimícos meos. ^ My God
column3: his mercy shall prevent me~; God shall let me see over my enemies.

column2: neqŭándo obliviscántur pòpuli mei. Dispèrge illos in virtúte tua
column7: lest at any time my people forget. Scatter them by thy power

column3: et comprehendantur in supèrbia sua. Et de exsecratióne et mendácio adnuntiabùntur
column6: and let them be taken in their pride. And for their cursing and lying they shall be talked of

column3: et non èrunt. Et scient qŭia Deus dominábitur Jacóbem
column4: et fínium terraĕ. ^ when they are consumed
column5: when they are consumed by thy wrath
column6: and they shall be no more. And they shall know that God will rule Jacob
column7: and all the ends of the earth.

column3: et circumíbunt civitátem. ^ They shall return at evening
column4: and shall suffer hunger as dogs
column5: and shall go round about the city.

column3: et murmurábunt. ^ They shall be scattered abroad to eat
column4: if truely they shall not be filled

column2: et exsultábo mane misericórdiam tuam. Qŭia factus ès suscèptor meus
column4: in die tribulatiónis meaĕ. ^ But I will sing thy strength
column5: and will extol thy mercy in the morning. For thou art become my support
column7: in the day of my trouble.

column5: will unto thee will I sing
